post.content:
Board Recruitment: BLKOUT Creative Ltd

BLKOUT is recruiting non-executive directors to govern our community-owned liberation technology platform serving Black queer men in the UK.

About Us:
BLKOUT operates a digital ecosystem including an AI assistant (IVOR), events calendar, news platform, and communications hub. We serve 10,000+ community members across London, Manchester, Birmingham, and Bristol, with social discovery and wellness apps launching in 2026.

Positions Available:

1. Chair
Provide strategic leadership and chair board meetings. Governance experience required.

2. Treasurer
Oversee financial health and sustainability. Finance/accounting background required.

3. Secretary
Ensure good governance and compliance. Administrative/legal background valued.

4. Technology Director
Strategic oversight of platform development. Tech leadership experience required.

5. Community Director
Ensure community voice in governance. Community organizing experience valued.

Commitment: 4-6 hours/month, quarterly meetings, 3-year terms
Compensation: Voluntary with expenses reimbursed
Support: Comprehensive onboarding, training, D&O insurance

We particularly welcome applications from:
- Black professionals
- LGBTQ+ individuals
- Those with lived experience in our communities
- Finance, legal, technology, and third sector professionals

This is an opportunity to shape the future of ethical, community-owned technology.

Application deadline: February 21st, 2026
Apply: blkoutuk.com/board
Contact: governance@blkoutuk.com

#BoardRecruitment #Governance #SocialEnterprise #TechForGood #Diversity #CommunityOwnership #NonprofitLeadership #UKCharity #LGBTQ #BlackProfessionals

body.opening:
Dear boy, we need leaders like you.

BLKOUT is entering a new chapter. We've built the technology - AIvor, Events Calendar, News Platform, and more. Now we need governance to match our ambition.

We're recruiting 5 board members to help lead BLKOUT Creative Ltd into its next decade.
body.positions_overview: We're looking for a Chair to provide strategic leadership, a Treasurer to ensure financial sustainability, a Secretary to maintain good governance, a Technology Director to oversee our platform, and a Community Director to ensure community voice shapes every decision.
body.commitment: This is a voluntary role requiring 4-6 hours per month. We meet quarterly with additional communication as needed. We provide comprehensive onboarding, training opportunities, and full support.
body.who_should_apply: We're looking for people with governance experience, financial expertise, technology leadership, or community organizing backgrounds. Lived experience as a Black queer person is strongly valued but not required for all positions.
body.call_to_action:
The application deadline is February 21st. Apply at blkoutuk.com/board or email governance@blkoutuk.com with questions.

The revolution needs governance, dear boy. Come govern with us.
body.sign_off:
With revolutionary love,
The BLKOUT Team

griot.prompt: Create compelling storytelling content for BLKOUT's board recruitment campaign. The content should communicate the significance of this moment - building lasting institutions for Black queer communities. Use the IVOR Cummings voice (warm, wise, encouraging). Emphasize that we're not just looking for board members, we're looking for people to help govern the revolution. Include the emotional weight of building something that will outlast us all.

strategist.prompt: Develop a 3-week campaign strategy for BLKOUT's board recruitment. Target audiences include: 1) Black professionals in finance/law/tech who want to give back, 2) Community organizers looking for governance experience, 3) LGBTQ+ professionals in corporate/charity sectors. Recommend optimal posting times, content sequencing, and engagement tactics to maximize qualified applications.

herald.prompt: Create a newsletter announcing BLKOUT's board recruitment. The newsletter should clearly explain the 5 positions, the commitment required, and why this matters for the community. Include a strong call to action with the February 21st deadline. Make it feel like an invitation, not a job posting.

weaver.prompt: Prepare engagement responses for the board recruitment campaign. Anticipate questions about: time commitment, skills required, whether lived experience is necessary, the application process, and what board members actually do. Create warm, encouraging responses in the IVOR voice that make people feel capable of contributing.

listener.prompt: Research and identify: 1) Similar board recruitment campaigns by LGBTQ+ organizations in the UK, 2) Best practices for diverse board recruitment, 3) Potential amplification partners (UK Black Pride, Stonewall, Black professionals networks, LGBTQ+ LinkedIn groups), 4) Relevant hashtags and communities to target.
